oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Assessing the risk of subclinical infections in cows with clinical mastitis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Scillieri Smith, Jessica C.
Morrill, Kimberley M.
Gauthier, Heather M.
Dann, Heather M.
Ballard, Catherine S.
Rauch, Bradley J.
Virkler, Paul D.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Clinical mastitis
somatic cell count
normal milk
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The objective of this project was to evaluate the risk of SCM in NCQs of cows with CM in comparison to animals with normal milk. Our hypothesis is that cows with CM in one quarter are at a higher risk of SCM in NCQs when compared to low and high somatic cell count (SCC) control groups.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2019; 360
